summary: This bill, the PLO and PA Terror Payments Accountability Act of 2025, aims to impose sanctions on foreign persons and financial institutions that support terrorism by providing payments to terrorists and their families through the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) and the Palestinian Authority (PA). It mandates the President to block property, deny visas, and potentially revoke existing visas of those involved. The bill defines key terms, outlines reporting requirements to Congress, and provides for termination of sanctions if the specified compensation system ceases. It references the Taylor Force Act and condemns acts of terrorism by Hamas and other groups.
